on reading compounds: 呆ける【ボケル】to grow senile, to be childish with age, to be mentally slow, to be befuddled, to play stupid, to say something stupid (oft. on purpose; esp. as part of a comedic routine), to become engrossed in, to become absorbed in
踊る阿呆に見る阿呆【オドルアホウニミルアホウ】you're a fool if you dance, and a fool if you just look on; we're all fools, so let's dance
kun reading compounds: 呆ける【ぼける】to grow senile, to be childish with age, to be mentally slow, to be befuddled, to play stupid, to say something stupid (oft. on purpose; esp. as part of a comedic routine), to become engrossed in, to become absorbed in
呆れる【あきれる】to be amazed, to be shocked, to be astonished, to be astounded, to be disgusted, to be exasperated, to be fed up
